source_sentence: 摩耶夫人既見是已，亦復流淚，鯁塞嗚咽。

source_sentence: 宮內大小，亦悉悲啼，流涕如雨。

translation: When the prince was about to be born, five hundred princes of the Śākya clan were born on the same day. In sum, as many as five hundred girls are born on the same day.

source_sentence: 五百奴僕、五百婢媵、五百馬駒，五百白象皆悉六牙，一時同日，集宮門外。

source_sentence: 五百伏藏，自然湧出；

source_sentence: 五百商主，從諸方來迦毘羅城，五百傘蓋、五百金瓶，外方諸王，隣境珠珍，

source_sentence: 悉來送我，復跪拜我。
translation: They all came to send me off and knelt down to worship me.

source_sentence: 復有一萬天諸童女，並在長者及婆羅門剎利家生。

source_sentence: 童子生日，我一切利，皆悉得成，我心願者，皆滿具足。
translation: On my birthday, the boy's birthday, all of my benefits will be accomplished, and whatever I wish for in my mind, they'll all be fulfilled.

source_sentence: 我喚國內諸善解相婆羅門等明吉凶者，悉皆召集。
translation: I summoned the well-understood brāhmaṇas and others in my country to explain good fortune and bad fortune, and they all called together.

source_sentence: 彼等見此童子形容，皆大歡喜，踊躍充遍，不能自勝。
translation: Seeing the boy’s good appearance, they all rejoiced greatly. Filled with joy and ecstatic, they could not control themselves.

source_sentence: 唯獨尊師，今見童子，何故悲啼？
translation: Only the venerable teacher alone, seeing the boy now, why would he cry in sorrow?

source_sentence: 「時阿私陀見淨飯王，涕淚交瞼愁憂悵怏，而白王言：『大王今者莫愁莫憂。
translation: When Asita saw King Śuddhodana, weeping and grieved, he said to the king, 'Now, great king, don't worry or grieve.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 我今非是見於童子有災有變，亦不見有諸餘苦惱，不見身內及外不祥。
translation: I don't now see that there's calamity or change in the boy, and I don't see any other kind of suffering or distress, and I don't see internal or external badness.

source_sentence: 大王！

translation: You should know that the youthful Licchavi Vimalakīrti had a long life span and was endowed with majestic virtue. He was gracefully handsome and pleasing to be seen. His hair stood on end like an umbrella over his head, yellow-white as white as gold.

source_sentence: 鼻若截筒，身體洪滿，支節自稱，猶如金像。
translation: His nose was like a cut off from a tube, and his body was so full that the limbs called themselves as if they were made of gold.

source_sentence: 身有三十二丈夫相，大王！
translation: Your body has the thirty-two marks of a man, great king!

source_sentence: 此之童子兼有八十微妙種好，大王！
translation: This boy has eighty subtle and beautiful features at the same time, great king!

source_sentence: 如是諸相，非是轉輪聖王之種。
translation: Such marks are not the seeds of a wheel-turning sage king.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 如是相者，皆是諸佛菩薩之相。
translation: Such marks are all the marks of buddhas and bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 是故我見童子，決定得成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，轉於無上清淨法輪，為彼諸天世間人等說法，
translation: For this reason I see you, prince of gods, who will surely attain unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment and turn the supremely pure wheel of the Dharma in order to teach the Dharma for the sake of all living beings.

source_sentence: 安樂一切眾生。
translation: It brings peace and comfort to all sentient beings.

translation: The treasure of the Dharma is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, up to the point where it teaches the pure practice of austerity. If someone hears and receives the Dharma from that side, they should be born into sentient beings, which is to say, they will cut off [their] birth.

source_sentence: 應老眾生即斷老法，應病斷病，應死斷死，憂悲苦惱一切眾生，皆蒙解脫。
translation: When sentient beings grow old, they stop the dharma of old age, when illnesses are stopped by illness, and when death is stopped by death, all sentient beings who suffer from grief and sorrow are liberated.

translation: Great king!

translation: World-Honored One, I am now grieved because my faculties have matured and my old age is approaching its end. At that very moment I will not be able to see the great reward for which I shall lose it. For this reason I feel sorrowful and saddened by myself.

translation: Isn't it because I've lost the great benefit of hearing nothing in a single lifetime from emptiness?

translation: Countless and limitless sentient beings, etc., will be able to extinguish the fires of greed, hatred, and delusion when tormented by them and give subtle water of the Teaching, the ambrosia of immortality.

source_sentence: 無量無邊諸惡眾生，已入邪見曠野澤中，不見正道迷惑之時，此當能與淳直涅槃平坦好道；
translation: Innumerable and limitless evil sentient beings have already entered the wilderness of wrong views. When they are confused by not seeing the right path, these will be able to give them the peaceful and good path of unadulterated nirvana.

source_sentence: 無量無邊諸苦眾生，閉在煩惱牢獄之中，此當能解一切業縛；
translation: Innumerable, boundless sentient beings shut in the prison of afflictions will be able to free them from all bonds of action.

source_sentence: 無量無邊愚暝眾生，長夜昏闇覆翳重盲，此當為生大智慧眼；
translation: Innumerable and boundless ignorant sentient beings who spend long nights in darkness, covered with dullness and heavy blindness, here will be born the eye of great wisdom.

source_sentence: 無量無邊染著眾生，以被煩惱毒箭所射，此當拔濟令免其苦。
translation: Because sentient beings with measureless and limitless defilements are shot by the poisonous arrow of affliction, this will remove them and free them from their suffering.

source_sentence: 我今年垂，身心退敗，慨恨彼時不見此法，是以啼泣。
translation: World-Honored One, this year has passed and my body and mind have regressed. I am saddened that I did not see this phenomenon at the time. That is why I weep and wail.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 如優曇花，無量無邊億千萬年，時一出現；
translation: It is like the udumbara flower, which appears once every millions of years for an immeasurable and limitless eon.

source_sentence: 諸佛如是，無量無邊千萬億劫，出世甚難。
translation: The buddhas are like this for measureless and limitless thousands of myriads of koṭis of kalpas, which make it very difficult to appear in the world.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 今此童子，決定得成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，決定轉於無上法輪。
translation: Now, this boy will surely attain supreme perfect enlightenment and will surely turn the unsurpassed wheel of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 我自傷過不值此時，今當背彼，是故悲泣。
translation: I am grieved that it is not the right time for me to do so, and now I will turn my back on them. That is why I weep with sorrow.

source_sentence: 大王！

translation: Those sentient beings will greatly attain wealth and benefit and greatly attain meritorious deeds. If they can see this holy boy in that place under the bodhi tree,

translation: Those who sit and subdue the four Māras and are able to attain anger will greatly benefit those sentient beings and greatly liberate them.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 若能見此大聖童子得菩提已，漸漸至於波羅[木*奈]國，當轉無上最妙法輪，
translation: If you can see this great holy boy who has attained enlightenment, gradually reaching the country of Benares, you will turn the supremely wonderful wheel of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 一切眾生，大獲勝果。
translation: All sentient beings will greatly attain superior results.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 此之童子，莊嚴清淨是閻浮提，諸聖沙門，皆悉教令得阿羅漢，作其弟子。
translation: The adornment and purity of this boy is Jambudvīpa, and the sages and ascetics all teach him to attain arhatship and become his disciple.

source_sentence: 是故我啼。
translation: That's why I cried.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 彼等眾生，善得人身，善來此世，大得財利，大種福業。
translation: Those sentient beings well attain human bodies, are well come to this world, greatly attain wealth and benefit, and greatly cultivate meritorious actions.

source_sentence: 又復得見童子，至於三十三天諸天圍遶，乘七寶梯，而下彼處，無量無邊眾生，
translation: Again, the enlightening being Universally Good saw Sudhana go down a seven-jeweled ladder in the sky of the thirty-three-fold heavens, surrounded by hundreds of thousands of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 禮拜大王，王今亦善得此人身，大得財利及以法利。
translation: I venerate the great king, who has now well obtained this man's body, which will greatly benefit him in terms of wealth and Dharma benefits.

source_sentence: 若王當見自子得道，於天人中說是妙法，獲證無疑。』
translation: If the king sees that his own son has attained the path and teaches this wonderful teaching among gods and humans, he'll realize it without doubt.'

source_sentence: 「時，淨飯王從彼仙人阿私陀邊聞此語已，生大歡喜，即從座起，整理衣服，
translation: “Then King Śuddhodana heard these words from the side of that holy man Asita. Hearing them, he was greatly delighted. Then he rose from his seat and arranged his clothes.

source_sentence: 右膝著地，合十指掌，向於仙人，歡喜倍常，得未曾有。
translation: With his right knee touching the ground, he joined his palms with ten fingers and faced the holy man, rejoicing even more joyfully. He attained an unprecedented experience.

source_sentence: 遍身毛竪，頂禮其足，却住一面，將二十具上妙衣裳，布施仙人。
translation: The hair all over his body stood on end, bowed at his feet, withdrew to one side, and presented twenty pieces of fine raiment to the ṛṣi.

translation: Asita then accepted only one of the twenty pieces of clothing he offered as alms, to be used for his own use. Having accepted one piece of clothing,

translation: The rest of his robes were returned to King Jīvaka and given back to him, and he said, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 當知，我出家人，婆羅門種，無多威德，少欲無求，應須知足。
translation: You should know that I am a renunciant of the householder’s life. Being a brahman by caste, I lack much power and virtue. With few desires and no one to ask for anything, I need to be content.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 國主賜賚處寬，財物有限，當任意用，自他已然。
translation: The sovereign of the country will be given a generous allowance, and his possessions will be limited; he may use them freely as he wishes. So be it for himself or others.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 童子在於母胎，希有之事，理應無邊。
translation: When a child is in his mother's womb, rare things should be limitless in principle.

source_sentence: 生育已前，所有瑞相，唯願大王為我盡說。
translation: Before you give birth, all the auspicious signs and marks belong to your majesty. May Your Majesty tell me everything about them!

source_sentence: 我得聞已，是大布施，令我歡喜，踊躍充遍，不能自勝，此則是我大得財寶。』
translation: After I hear it, this is a great gift that will cause me to rejoice and jump for joy, filling my heart with joy and unable to overcome it; this is how I'll attain great wealth and treasure.'

source_sentence: 「『次有人來，乃至自然五百香象，身白如雪，齊有六牙，在宮門外。
translation: 'Second, someone comes along with five hundred fragrant elephants that naturally have white bodies as white as snow and all have six tusks outside the palace gates.

source_sentence: 「『次有人來，乃至五百金藏隱伏，自然顯現。
translation: 'Second, someone will come along, even if the five hundred treasures of gold are hidden and naturally manifested.

source_sentence: 「『次有人來，乃至此處，迦毘羅城，自然而有五百園林，忽爾出現。
translation: 'Second, someone came and went up to this place, where the city of Kapilavastu, which naturally had five hundred parks and forests, suddenly appeared.

source_sentence: 「『次有人來，乃至他方五百商主，多齎財寶，來至於此迦毘羅城。
translation: 'Second, someone will come, or even five hundred merchants from another place with a large amount of wealth and possessions will come to this city of Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 「『次有人來，乃至將於五百白蓋，五百金瓶，粟散諸王，送來奉獻，
translation: 'Second, there will be a person who comes along with five hundred white canopies, five hundred golden vases, and scattered among the kings to present them.

source_sentence: 并復遣人，諮白我言：「我等皆待大王教命，依勅而行。」
translation: He also sent someone to consult me, saying, We all await the great king's instruction and act accordingly.

source_sentence: 「『次有人來，而語我言：「願王常勝，有萬童女，在於剎利及婆羅門長者家生。」
translation: 'Second, someone came and said to me, May the king always be victorious, and there are 10,000 girls born in the homes of the kṣatriyas and brāhmaṇa elders.'

source_sentence: 大師！
translation: Great teacher!

source_sentence: 我於爾時，如是思惟：「我作何乘，將我童子安隱還向迦毘羅城？」
translation: At that point, I thus thought, What vehicle will I use to lead my boy back to Kapilavastu in peace?

source_sentence: 是時空中，有一天輿，七寶所成，非人工造，忽然而現，端正可喜，種種莊嚴。
translation: At the time, there was a celestial palanquin in the sky made of seven treasures, not man-made, that suddenly appeared, pleasingly handsome and variously adorned.

source_sentence: 「『大師！
translation: 'Great master!

source_sentence: 我於彼時，作是思惟：「誰負此輿？」
translation: At the time, I thought, Who is carrying this carriage?

source_sentence: 是時四方自然而有四天子來，來已各各擔負寶輿，離地不遠，乘空而行。
translation: At that time four celestial beings spontaneously came from the four directions, each carrying a precious carriage not far from the ground and traveling in midair.

source_sentence: 我於爾時，將是童子入於宮殿，覆復思惟：「今我童子，作何名也？」
translation: At that point, I took this boy into the palace and again thought, What's the name of my boy now?

source_sentence: 我更思惟：「其生之日，我一切利，自然而成。」
translation: I further thought, On the day he's born, all my benefits will naturally come into being.

source_sentence: 我時知已，便作名字，號悉達多。
translation: Knowing this, I then took the name Siddhârtha.

source_sentence: 「『大師！
translation: 'Great master!

source_sentence: 爾時我復於此城內，諸有相師，能占吉凶，一切召喚，示此童子，令其觀看：「汝等一切諸婆羅門，
translation: At that time, I was also in this city. The soothsayers were able to divine the signs of good or bad omens and called out to all the young brahmans so that they might watch me.

source_sentence: 為我好觀此之童子，有何相貌？
translation: What's the characteristic of this boy who likes to look at me?

source_sentence: 復有何怪？」
translation: What's the strange thing?

source_sentence: 而相師等，聞我語已，共瞻童子，各各相議，而報我言：「大王！
translation: When the soothsayers heard my words, they each had a discussion with the boy gaze and reported to me, saying, Great king!

source_sentence: 汝得大利，如是童子，有大威德，生大王家，具足三十二大人相。
translation: You've gained great benefits, such a boy with great authority and virtue who's born in the king's house and possesses thirty-two major characteristics.

source_sentence: 若當有人具足如是丈夫相者，此人則有二種之行：若其在家，必定當作轉輪聖王，
translation: Suppose there is someone who possesses the characteristics of a man like this. Such a person will have two kinds of behavior:

source_sentence: 王四天下，七寶具足，乃至不用一切兵戈，如法治化；
translation: He ruled over the four quarters of the empire and possessed the seven kinds of treasure, so much so that he did not use any weapon to subjugate his people.

source_sentence: 若其捨家修學聖道，必得作佛、多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀，名聞遍滿一切世間。」
translation: If they abandon their home and cultivate the noble path, they'll surely become buddhas, tathāgatas, arhats, and samyak-saṃbuddhas whose names and reputations will pervade all the worlds.

source_sentence: 「『大師！
translation: 'Great master!

source_sentence: 我於爾時，將百味食，設彼一切諸婆羅門，皆悉充足，自恣布施種種衣服。
translation: At the time, I offered a hundred tasty foods to all those brāhmaṇas and gave them various kinds of clothing as an offering.

source_sentence: 「『大師！
translation: 'Great master!

source_sentence: 我於彼時，在此城內，所有街巷，四衢道頭，皆行布施，須食與食，資財五行，
translation: At the time, I was staying in this city. All the streets and thoroughfares at the four corners of the roads all offered alms food and provided five ways to store up my belongings.

source_sentence: 皆持施與，乃至所得諸功德者，迴施童子，為供養故。
translation: They all give back the merits they've attained, even if they're given back to the boy as an offering.

source_sentence: 大師！
translation: Great teacher!

source_sentence: 童子在胎初生之時，有如是等種種瑞相希奇之事未曾有法，諸如是等在胎生法，
translation: When the prince was born in the womb, he had such and such various miraculous signs and rare things that were unprecedented. Such and such are the signs of birth in the womb.

source_sentence: 我今具白大師令知。
translation: Now, I'll tell the great master to let him know.

source_sentence: 今奉大師，如是布施，唯願大師！
translation: Now, I'll present this kind of gift to the great teacher, so please, great teacher!

source_sentence: 領受歡喜。』
translation: They'll be joyful when they receive it.'

source_sentence: 「爾時尊者阿私陀仙，從童子父淨飯王邊，聞此微妙諸瑞相等，生大歡喜，
translation: “At that time the venerable sage Asita, who was staying at King Sudarśana’s side in the palace of his father Candracchattra, heard these subtle omens equalize and rejoiced greatly.

source_sentence: 不能自勝。
translation: They can't overcome themselves.

source_sentence: 從座而起辭王出宮，步至門外，即以右手，執那羅陀童子左臂，從門隱身，
translation: He rose from his seat and departed. The king came out of the palace, stepped outside the door, took the boy Nārada’s left arm in his right hand, and withdrew through the door to hide himself.

source_sentence: 騰虛而行，向南天竺，下阿槃提聚落之時，阿私陀仙語那羅陀童子，作是言：『汝那羅陀童子當知！
translation: When he ascended up the air and traveled south to India and descended down to the village of Abandi, the sage Asita said to the boy Nārada, 'You, Nārada boy, should know!'

source_sentence: 有佛出現於今世間，汝當彼邊，出家學道，修習梵行，久遠之時，大得利益，
translation: If a buddha were to appear in this world, you should stay away from it, renounce the householder’s life, study the path of religion, and practice austerity. For a long time to come you would gain great benefit.

source_sentence: 大得安樂。』
translation: They'll greatly attain peace and comfort.'

source_sentence: 時阿私陀，覆復思惟：『我滅度後，所有利養，世間名聞，一切皆是那羅童子悉收斂得。
translation: Asita then again thought, 'After my parinirvāṇa, all the benefits and rewards of worldly fame will be collected by the boy Nāra.'

source_sentence: 是故此之那羅童子，因利養故，世名聞故，盡其道行，不得精進，不得正念，
translation: For this reason, because of their profits and gains and worldly fame and reputation, these Nārāyaṇa children have exhausted the practice of enlightenment. They do not attain energy and right mindfulness.

source_sentence: 不得信行，於三寶邊不能分別，此是佛陀，此是達摩，此是僧伽，是故名聞損彼自身。』
translation: They can't believe and practice, and they can't discriminate between the three treasures; this is Buddha, this is Dharma, and this is Saṃgha, which is why they're called hearing and harming themselves.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，尊者阿私陀仙更復思惟：『是淨飯王悉達童子，在何國地當得成於阿耨多羅三藐三菩提？
translation: At the time, Venerable Asita again thought, 'In which land will this boy King Jīvaka Siddhārtha attain supreme perfect enlightenment?'

source_sentence: 復在何處轉於清淨無上法輪？』
translation: Where else will he turn the pure and unsurpassed wheel of the Dharma?'

source_sentence: 如是少時思惟訖已，內心明見，知是童子其後於彼摩伽陀國，當得阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，
translation: Having thought thus for a little while, he saw clearly in his mind that the prince would later attain highest, complete enlightenment in the kingdom of Magadha.

source_sentence: 波羅[木*奈]國，轉於法輪。
translation: The country of Vārāṇasī turned the wheel of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 『我於今者，當應將此那羅童子詣波羅[木*奈]，造一精舍，安置立已，
translation: 'Now, I should take this Nāraputta to Benares [munai] and build a temple for him.

source_sentence: 晝日三時，暗夜三時，向彼為其說佛名號，汝那羅陀，佛出於世！
translation: At the three times of the day and three times of the night, in the darkness, he teaches them the names of the buddhas by addressing them, saying, You named Rāhula, the Buddha has appeared in the world!

source_sentence: 汝那羅陀，佛出於世！
translation: You, Nārada, the Buddha has appeared in the world!

source_sentence: 如是三稱，汝應彼邊，出家修道，懃行梵行，汝當後時，有大利益，得大安樂。』
translation: Such are these three calls, so you should go to the other side, leave home, cultivate your path, and engage in religious practice; at some point later, you'll have great benefit and great peace and happiness.'

source_sentence: 時阿私陀，作是念已，將那羅陀向波羅[木*奈]，為造精舍，安置立已，
translation: Asita then had this thought, led Nārada toward Benares [munai] to build a temple and set it there.

source_sentence: 晝夜六時，作是唱言：『汝那羅陀，佛興於世！』
translation: At six o'clock during the day and night, he made this proclamation, saying, 'You, Nārada, the Buddha arises in the world!'

source_sentence: 晝夜六時，如是三唱：『汝當出家，乃至後時，得大安樂。』
translation: At six o'clock during the day and night, he thus sings three times, 'You must leave home, and at some point later you'll attain great peace and comfort.'

source_sentence: 時阿私陀如是方便，住世無量而取壽終。
translation: Asita then thus skillfully abided in the world for an immeasurable number of years and took his life to end.

source_sentence: 「時阿私陀命終之後，其那羅陀侍者童子，於世間中，得大利養，得大名聞。
translation: “After Asita’s death, the attendant boy Nārada attained great reward and fame in the world.

source_sentence: 時那羅陀，著世利養，貪名聞故，心不自定，不能增進，以求利養，不知足故，
translation: Nārada then became attached to worldly gains and profits, craving fame and learning because his mind wasn’t self-contained; he couldn’t increase it because he didn’t know how to satisfy himself by seeking profits and profits.

source_sentence: 不能自念，不能自信，不能分別，此是佛耶？
translation: They can't think for themselves, can't believe in themselves, and can't discern. Is this the Buddha?

source_sentence: 此是法耶？
translation: Is this the Dharma?

source_sentence: 此是僧耶？
translation: Is this the Sangha?

source_sentence: 彼阿私陀命終之後，時淨飯王語諸國師婆羅門言：『大師當知！
translation: When Asita's life ended, King Śuddhodana said to the national teachers and brāhmaṇas, 'You should know, teacher!'

source_sentence: 今此太子，既生王宮，不久必當行於聖行，證得聖道，猶如尊者大阿私陀仙人授記。
translation: Now that the prince has been born in the royal palace, he will surely soon practice holy deeds and realize the holy path, just as the sage Mahā Asita predicted.

source_sentence: 此言真實，恐當不虛，必應如是。
translation: This statement is true, and I'm afraid it won't be false; it must be like this.

source_sentence: 大師！
translation: Great teacher!

source_sentence: 我王種族，若為嗣立，當大損減。』
translation: If my king's clan were to heir it, it would be greatly diminished.'

source_sentence: 其婆羅門諸國師，報淨飯王言：『大王！
translation: The Brahman scholars replied to King Jīvaka, saying, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 今者莫作是念，如我授記，此之太子，必當定作轉輪聖王。
translation: Don't think like this; just as I predicted, this prince will surely become a wheel-turning sage king.

source_sentence: 如我等語，終無有異。』
translation: As we say, there's never any difference.'

source_sentence: 「時淨飯王語國師言：『仁等大師！
translation: The king of Jīvaka then said to the national teacher, 'Your majesty!

source_sentence: 汝於今者非阿私陀聖師之言，此語虛謬。』
translation: 'Now, you're not the words of the noble teacher Asita, and these words are false.'

source_sentence: 時彼國師婆羅門等，更報王言：『彼仙人語，若其不虛，言是實者，大王！
translation: The national teacher and other brāhmaṇas then reported to the king, saying, 'That sage's words are true if they aren't false but say it's true, great king!'

source_sentence: 今應須作方便，及年少時，增益世事，當觀太子，著於何者？
translation: Now, you must make an effort to increase worldly affairs when you're young, and you should observe what the prince is attached to.

source_sentence: 漸漸更加，如是則彼自愛家居，不向山林，修於苦行。』
translation: Gradually and gradually, they'll thus love their own home, don't go to the mountains or forests, and cultivate austerities.'

source_sentence: 「時，淨飯王復問國師婆羅門言：『此事云何？』
translation: The king of Jīvaka then again asked the national teacher, the Brāhmaṇa, 'What's the matter?'

source_sentence: 時國師等復白王言：『大王！
translation: The national teachers then again said to the king, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 當知，往古諸仙，或飲風露，或食花果，或食根藥，著樹皮衣，少欲知足。
translation: You should know that ancient sages may have drunk wind and dew, eat flowers and fruits, eat roots and herbs, wear tree bark robes, and have few desires and are satisfied.

source_sentence: 彼等諸仙，猶愛俗事，一著於世，尚生放逸。
translation: Those sages still loved worldly affairs and were attached to worldly affairs, yet they indulged in heedlessness.

source_sentence: 況復太子，日日習近，一切諸根，自然染著。
translation: How much more so when the prince is accustomed to it day after day, and all his faculties naturally become defiled.

source_sentence: 以王勢力具足功德，住在家內，能捨出家，無有是處。』
translation: Because the king's power is replete with merit, there's no place for him to stay inside his home and be able to leave home.'

source_sentence: 時淨飯王復作是言：『此事如是，如大師語，世間亦有方便之事，如大師說。
translation: King Śuddhodana then again said, 'So it is with this matter, just as the great master said, and there are also works of skillful means in the world, just as the great master said.

source_sentence: 但彼大仙阿私陀說，必不虛言，是故我心常生疑惑。』
translation: But what that great sage Asita said mustn't be false, so I always have doubts in my mind.'

source_sentence: 時淨飯王思惟如是未來之事，心疑猶預，即集群臣諸釋種族，而告之言：『我勅汝等！
translation: When King Śuddhodana thought about such future events, he had doubts in his mind and gathered his ministers and members of the Śākya clan together, telling them, 'I command you!'

source_sentence: 若見太子增長之時，莫向彼前說阿私陀授記之事。
translation: If you see that the prince grows, don't tell him or her about the assurance of Asita's prediction.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 太子若聞如此語者，其喜不捨菩提之心。』
translation: If the prince hears such words, he'll be delighted and won't abandon his mind of enlightenment.'

source_sentence: 「時，淨飯王復更重告諸臣等言：『卿諸臣等！
translation: Again, King Śuddhodana again addressed the ministers, saying, 'Your ministers!

source_sentence: 為我太子，國內所有禁繫囚徒，皆悉放赦，令得解脫，乃至一切諸禽獸等，
translation: For my sake, prince, all the imprisoned prisoners in our country will be released and allowed to be liberated, including all the animals and birds.

source_sentence: 亦並放捨。』
translation: They'll also abandon it.'

source_sentence: 復告國師婆羅門言：『大師！
translation: Again, he told the national teacher, the Brāhmaṇa, 'Great master!

source_sentence: 若知所有精進婆羅門等，或百或千，聚集之處，隨意所須，悉皆布施。
translation: Suppose you know that all the diligent brāhmaṇas and so forth, whether a hundred or a thousand in number, gathered together to give whatever they wanted.

source_sentence: 所有天祠及神廟堂，皆令修治，依法祭祀，為我太子，令得大福。』
translation: All the gods' shrines and shrine halls will be cultivated, ritualized according to the Dharma, and made my prince to attain great fortune.'

source_sentence: 爾時國師婆羅門等，即依王命，四方召得三萬二千諸婆羅門，日別令入淨飯王宮，
translation: At that time the brahman teachers of the country and others, in accordance with the king’s order, summoned thirty-two thousand brahmans from the four directions to enter the palace of King Śuddhodana separately on each day.

source_sentence: 所有資財，悉持布施，滿七日夜，所有功德，迴施太子，願令增進。
translation: For seven days and nights he gave away all his possessions to the prince, wishing to increase their merit.

source_sentence: 「『淨飯王心大歡喜，　　以生福德太子故，
translation: The king Śuddhodana was greatly delighted, Because he had produced the prince Virtuous.

source_sentence: 一切群臣皆聚集，　　天下囚繫普放恩，
translation: All the ministers are assembled, The world’s imprisoned and released benefactors everywhere.

source_sentence: 誕育既稱適本心，　　慇重欲為作生法。
translation: Since birth and nurture are called appropriate to the original mind, debilitating desire is the method of birth.

source_sentence: 持彼百千乳牛犢，　　皆金裝角銀飾蹄，
translation: They carried hundreds of thousands of milk cows and calves, All decorated with golden horns and silver hooves.

source_sentence: 年齒悉壯毛色鮮，　　各各從犢隨其後，
translation: Their years and teeth are all strong, their hair pure in color, Each following the calf behind him.

source_sentence: 膚體充肥多乳汁，　　一頭一捋得十斗，
translation: Their complexion and body were full of fat and plenty of milk juice. Each drop of milk they poured for ten sheng [to their bodies].

source_sentence: 更有無量種珍奇，　　錢財穀帛諸雜物，
translation: There were also innumerable other kinds of rare treasures, Such as money, goods, grain, silk, and various miscellaneous things.

source_sentence: 為令太子增益故，　　布施於彼婆羅門。』
translation: In order to cause the prince to increase, he gives it to that brāhmaṇa.'

source_sentence: 而有偈說：佛本行集經卷第十
translation: Instead, there is a verse that says: The Collection of the Scriptures on the Original Acts of the Buddha, Volume 10
